title-group.article-title: Qualification of a 4K Mechanical Cooler for Space Applications

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1995 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: British Aerospace Space Systems (BAe) have been awarded a contract by the European Space Agency (ESA) to industrialise the long life 4K mechanical cooler previously developed by Rutherford Appleton Laboratory (RAL). The requirement included a detailed review of design, manufacture of an EM cooler, followed by a characterisation and environmental test programme to pre-flight qualification levels. The cooler consists of a two-stage Stirling Cycle precooler, and a closed cycle Joule Thomson stage for achievement of 4K. This paper describes the design and discusses the industrialisation activities and the proposed test programme.

ref.mixed-citation: Bradshaw T and Orłowska A. A 4K Mechanical Refrigerator for Space Applications. Proceedings of the 3rd European Symposium on Space Thermal Control and Life Support Systems, Noordwijk,The Netherlands, October 1988.
Bradshaw T and Orłowska A. A Closed Cycle 4K Mechanical Cooler for Space Applications. Proceedings of the European Symposium on Space Thermal Control, Florence, Italy, October 1991.

Jones B G et al. Long Life Stirling Cycle Cooler Developments for the Space Application Range of 20K to 80K. Proceedings of the 7th International Cryocooler Conference, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA, November 1992.
Werrett S T et al. Development of a Small Stirling Cycle Cooler for Space Flight Applications. Advance Cryogenic Eng., 31 791-799,(1986).
Scull S R et al. Pre-Qualifi cation Testing of an 80K Stirling Cycle Cooler. Proceedings of the European Symposium on Space Thermal Control, Florence, Italy, October 1991.
